body: And so I gaze avidlyAlthough December's frost killed the winter crop,So, startled, quivering,Seized from creation by nonentity,Traces of those deep cuts lie thickly uponThat rings, with faithful tongue, its pious noteThat this mud draws on the stone.And I would likeRight, and appears from here to be overcomeXV.
